front.title: LPWAN Static Context Header Compression (SCHC) for CoAP

abstract.t: This draft defines the way SCHC header compression can be applied to CoAP headers. The CoAP header structure differs from IPv6 and UDP protocols since CoAP uses a flexible header with a variable number of options, themselves of variable length. The CoAP protocol messages format is asymmetric: the request messages have a header format different from the one in the response messages. This document explains how to use the SCHC compression mechanism for CoAP.
